title: As a person in low ELO, I would like to thank people who play tanks in low ELO
body: I mean, I sincerely thank you.  I don't know how you play tank and not want to kill yourself after you finish a game.  We don't follow up on your engages, we seem to find a way to stay as far away from you and as close to their fed Ahri or Zed at all times, and we have no concept of upgrading trinkets so we have more than 0 map vision so we can't even contest objectives but you still do it.  You are truly a paragon of patience and understanding and I wish I was more like you guys, because I do not have the patience to play tank in low ELO.  Once again, thank you.

Part of being a tank is not giving up, even if our teams are being dumb.

Playing a tank is probably the easiest way to lead a team to victory.  Unless you are a god-tier carry it's really hard to push objectives as a squishy.  Furthermore, most tanks have high base damage and possess enough kill pressure to get fed early and snowball into an unstoppable force.  All those Sejuani bans are happening for a reason: players are more afraid of tanks than assassins.  This is a good thing, so take advantage of it.  Besides, tanks are way more forgiving to play and thus inherently low-risk : high-reward.

While I'd like to play more squishy supports in low/mid silver, I find it's best to pick Leona or something tanky. The enemy adc seems to always focus you because you're in their face while your adc if they're competent will kill them. Plus, with the lack of map awareness, It's far easier getting out of a gank alive with someone tanky with a stun than it is with 2 squishies in the bot lane.

Oh believe me, this season for ranked I've completely abandoned my native Top Lane because I actually wanted to climb.

I could be the super-est of Tanks with 4k HP and resistances to hell and back, but I know my carries will be screwing around while I'm peeling both of the enemy carries.

So in order to make it to gold, where I sincerely hope tanks can be appreciated, if even a little bit, I switched to an ADC main just so I actually control the outcome of my games.

My heart yearns for the days when I can play Top Lane in comfort.
